definition: to warm oneself (by a fire etc)

sentences.english: Students eat huddled around makeshift coal burners for warmth.
sentences.chinese: 學生們圍在煤爐旁邊喫飯邊取暖。

sentences.english: Horse dung could be used for home heating.
sentences.chinese: 馬糞可以用於家庭取暖。

sentences.english: The little country schoolhouse was heated by an old-fashioned , pot - bellied stove.
sentences.chinese: 那所小小的鄉村小學依靠一箇舊式的圓肚火爐取暖。

sentences.english: Mother draped her coat round the baby to keep him warm.
sentences.chinese: 母親用自己的衣服裹緊孩子以取暖。

sentences.english: The stoves will arrive in Xining on Tuesday, the ministry said.
sentences.chinese: 商務部發言人稱，取暖爐預計將於週二當天運抵西寧。

sentences.english: We cuddled up together and tried to get warm.
sentences.chinese: 我們依偎在一起，互相取暖。

sentences.english: While pumping the gas, we clapped our hands and jumped around to stay warm.
sentences.chinese: 加油時，我們一邊搓手一邊蹦來跳去地取暖。

sentences.english: They bunched around the fire for warmth.
Convert the gas into natural gas and sell it for residential heating and industrial use.
sentences.chinese: 將甲烷轉化成天然氣，用於住宅取暖和工業生產。

sentences.english: The old man roasted himself before the fire.
Fingers relative to their warm grip, only to maintain the moment.
sentences.chinese: 十指相握給自己取暖，只能維持的瞬間。

sentences.english: So like you, want to use you have given me memories of heating.
sentences.chinese: 於是想你，想用你曾經賜給我的回憶取暖。

sentences.english: It's about $ 55 dollars a day including heat , but excluding the service charge.
sentences.chinese: 包括取暖費在內每日55美元，但不包括服務費。

sentences.english: Better a little fire to warm us, than a at one to burn us.
sentences.chinese: 適量的火好取暖，熊熊烈火能焚身。

sentences.english: By sealing these leaks you can save on your heating bill.
sentences.chinese: 塞緊這些縫隙，可以省不少取暖費。

sentences.english: I slept with a thick quilt so that I needn't turn on the heater.
sentences.chinese: 我睡覺的時候蓋厚被子，以免耗電取暖。

definition: to warm oneself at a fire
to manufacture charcoal/to burn charcoal (often a reference to suicide by carbon monoxide poisoning)
to defend against the cold/to keep warm
